title: Netanyahu, Set to Give U.N. Speech, Vows to Keep Up Strikes on Hezbollah
content: The Israeli leader, who arrived in New York for the U.N. General Assembly, said, “We continue to hit Hezbollah with all our might.”
summary: The Israeli leader, who arrived in New York for the U.N. General Assembly, said, “We continue to hit Hezbollah with all our might.”

title: Israel’s Displaced Want to Go Home. But Will Attacks on Hezbollah Offer That Path?
content: Israel said the goal of its strikes on Hezbollah was to allow residents of the north to go home. Some are hopeful that plan will work, but others worry that war may not bring safety.
summary: Israel said the goal of its strikes on Hezbollah was to allow residents of the north to go home. Some are hopeful that plan will work, but others worry that war may not bring safety.

title: On Ukraine’s Eastern Front, A High-Stakes Struggle Against Russian Forces
content: With fall approaching, Ukraine says its forces in the eastern Donetsk region are facing battle more frequently than they have in months.
summary: With fall approaching, Ukraine says its forces in the eastern Donetsk region are facing battle more frequently than they have in months.

title: U.S. House Speaker Demands That Ukraine Fire Ambassador
content: The public call from Speaker Mike Johnson deals a blow to Kyiv’s efforts to avoid the partisan acrimony of the U.S. presidential campaign.
summary: The public call from Speaker Mike Johnson deals a blow to Kyiv’s efforts to avoid the partisan acrimony of the U.S. presidential campaign.

title: After 44 Years on Death Row, Japanese Man Is Exonerated at Age 88
content: Iwao Hakamada is believed to be the world’s longest-serving inmate given a death sentence.
summary: Iwao Hakamada is believed to be the world’s longest-serving inmate given a death sentence.

title: First It Was Lynch Mobs. Now Police Kill Pakistanis Accused of Blasphemy.
content: The deaths of two men have reverberated across Pakistan, where the charge of insulting Islam has long been a sensitive issue.
summary: The deaths of two men have reverberated across Pakistan, where the charge of insulting Islam has long been a sensitive issue.

title: Finnish Zoo Returning Pandas to China Because of Cost
content: Two pandas are heading back to China eight years early amid lower-than-hoped-for visitor numbers at a zoo in rural Finland, and after the pair didn’t produce a cub.
summary: Two pandas are heading back to China eight years early amid lower-than-hoped-for visitor numbers at a zoo in rural Finland, and after the pair didn’t produce a cub.

title: Why Curbing Hezbollah’s Power in Lebanon Just Became Harder
content: The militant group is a dominant force in the country, and officials have struggled for decades to limit its power.
summary: The militant group is a dominant force in the country, and officials have struggled for decades to limit its power.

title: Gisèle Pelicot Has Become a Feminist Hero in France Amid Rape Trial
content: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. Her poise and courage have made her an icon.
summary: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. Her poise and courage have made her an icon.

title: Senegal’s Young President Wants a New World Order
content: In his first interview with Western media since becoming president of Senegal, Bassirou Diomaye Faye said the United Nations has to change to reflect changing world demographics.
summary: In his first interview with Western media since becoming president of Senegal, Bassirou Diomaye Faye said the United Nations has to change to reflect changing world demographics.

title: Justin Trudeau’s Party Faces Confidence Vote as Canada Turns on Its Leader
content: Canada’s Liberals are reeling from a string of setbacks, even as the party survived a no-confidence vote in Parliament on Wednesday.
summary: Canada’s Liberals are reeling from a string of setbacks, even as the party survived a no-confidence vote in Parliament on Wednesday.

title: Online Scammers Posed as Brad Pitt to Get Cash, Spanish Police Say
content: The authorities in Spain said they had arrested five people who posed as the famous American actor online and swindled two women out of more than $350,000.
summary: The authorities in Spain said they had arrested five people who posed as the famous American actor online and swindled two women out of more than $350,000.

title: China Launched a Rocket With a Dummy Warhead Into the Pacific

title: Taiwan and U.S. Work to Counter China’s Drone Dominance

summary: Officials hope that Taiwan can become a bigger player in the supply chain for drones, a move that would also help blunt any threats posed to the island by China.

title: In Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley, Days of Destruction After Months of Calm
content: The Bekaa Valley, a Hezbollah bastion in eastern Lebanon, had mostly been spared over 11 months of war. But The New York Times saw widespread devastation there after intense Israeli airstrikes this week.
summary: The Bekaa Valley, a Hezbollah bastion in eastern Lebanon, had mostly been spared over 11 months of war. But The New York Times saw widespread devastation there after intense Israeli airstrikes this week.

title: The Wily Spy Who Risked His Life to Meet North Korea’s Secretive Leader
content: Park Chae-so was so successful in infiltrating the North that Kim Jong-il, the enigmatic ruler, once gifted him blueberry wine. So why was the celebrated undercover agent later jailed by South Korea?
summary: Park Chae-so was so successful in infiltrating the North that Kim Jong-il, the enigmatic ruler, once gifted him blueberry wine. So why was the celebrated undercover agent later jailed by South Korea?

title: Shigeru Ishiba to Be Next Prime Minister of Japan

title: Cyber Attack Displays ‘Islamophobic’ Message on U.K. Trains, Officials Say

title: Both Israel and Hezbollah Have Reasons to Reject a Cease-Fire Deal

title: France Rape Trial Renews Push to Revise Legal Definition of Rape
content: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. The trial has revived the question of consent within French law and turned Ms. Pelicot into a feminist icon. Catherine Porter, an international correspondent for The New York Times based in France, explains.
summary: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. The trial has revived the question of consent within French law and turned Ms. Pelicot into a feminist icon. Catherine Porter, an international correspondent for The New York Times based in France, explains.

title: In the Footsteps of Dostoyevsky in Three German Spa Towns
content: The Russian novelist, a compulsive gambler, lost everything in the opulent spa and gambling towns of Baden-Baden, Bad Homburg and Wiesbaden. An admirer of his books follows his footsteps.
summary: The Russian novelist, a compulsive gambler, lost everything in the opulent spa and gambling towns of Baden-Baden, Bad Homburg and Wiesbaden. An admirer of his books follows his footsteps.

title: Israel’s Attacks on Hezbollah Achieved Short-Term Aims, Officials Say
